Topic.Title: $12.50 is in view

Message.Msg: The 8% to 14% correction in the market is imminent. Could force BAC down to around $11.97 (if only 8% drop), or at least the low $12s. Because of the optimism concerning BofA's resolving outstanding problems it should do well in the long term and should be at least $20 by the end of next year. That is why it would probably only drop 8% if the rest of the market drops 14% in a correction. And only 4% (to $12.49) of the market only corrects 8%. You can guess that my buy order is between $11.97 and $12.49. But new highs might occur before that happens. Still, I can wait with open orders. Remember that BAC is frequently down on a Friday. If BAC closes off today it will probably close down even more tomorrow. I am not short but have moved 10% of my investment of BAC into cash to wait for the correction. My sentiment is Hold since I will still hold 90% of my BAC shares. That is my opinion and position today.

Message.Title: DRAM $2.85 UP 30 % ...BREAKING OUT!!!... WAS $30+ IN 2010....HUGE DRAM PRICE INCREASES AND NEW DEALS WITH AMD
Message.Msg: DRAM was a $30+ stock in 2010 when profitable. The stock is where it is because like any company in the sector was hit with plunging memory prices. But DRAM prices are now on an steady upwards trend....and expected to climb further in 2H and into 2014 and 2015. DRAM prices have jumped over 50% since January 2013. DRAM is now stronger than ever and far more diversified that in 2010. Yesterday (5/9) AMD announced a new line of fast processors aimed at the growing gaming industry. They announced that DRAM's RAMDisk technology is at the heart of AMD's new products!! DRAM will announce its return to profitability shortly and will enter many investors radars. This is the time to accumulate while it is still under the radar. InJohn H. Freeman, Dataram’s president and CEO commented, ..."Since the close of our third quarter on January 31, 2013 we have seen an increase in pricing which can positively impact our memory business for the balance of the fiscal year and beyond.” Mr. Freeman concluded, “In addition to a healthier semiconductor industry, we continue to develop and expand our relationship with Advanced Micro Devices, Inc., which together with our RAMDisk agreement and other new opportunities we are currently pursuing should provide new sources of revenue, profit and growth for Dataram in 2013 and beyond. ” DRAM after a recent 6/1 reverse split: - 1.7 Million Outstanding Shares - 1.4 M share float - 0.1 times sales (industry average 2) - Lat quarter near break even despite that average DRAM prices for the quarter were 50% lower than this quarter - Strong Balance Sheet - Recent big agreements with AMD and others to use their RAMDisk technology aimed at the gaming and other industries like Oil & gas, Financial, Medical....etc....where high processing speeds are desirable. - This quarter will likely produce 30 - 60c/share net income due to a huge explosion in the memory and server businesses

Topic.Title: Sanford wins SC, you really can't fix stupid !

Message.Msg: Since you were still in the womb when Clinton was around, I'll forgive your stupidity for assuming that Clinton intended to balance the budget. That was Gingrich and the 1994 rebellion, you incompetent idealogue. You really don't understand how this works, so I'll lay it out for you: If your side wins, you lose but I win. It will be a sour victory for me, because you will have cost yourself - and millions more minions like you - your own freedom. If your side loses, you win but don't know it and won't be able to take advantage of it. I win again regardless. See, you've staked yourself to a false premise that you are convinced is real and true, and it is neither of those things. Please understand that I'm not laughing at you. On the contrary, I feel sorry for you. Your childish enthusiasm and investment of hope and self and soul in socialist bureaucracy to deliver you from sitting in your own feces will not reward you. You'll only be tortured into continuing to vote for more in the hopes that some day it will trickle to you when it's your turn. And that is precisely what you've done so far, if you're even old enough to vote yet. You're like a gambling addict in that regard. News flash: your turn does not exist and never will. You can rely on yourself, or you can play Where's Siri with one of those pictures of the hundreds of cranial skeletons lined up in the pit. You will be forced into increasingly self-defiling acts to humor your betters, and they will not be amused for long, nor will they reward you for being stupid and catering to them. You will end up in the pit with the rest of them. And if by some "miracle" you don't, you will wish you had. Those are your only choices. No other exists. Now, go delude yourself and say something else stupid. You can't seem to do otherwise.

Message.Title: Uh oh
Message.Msg: (Reuters) - Bank of America Corp (BAC.N) will sell a commercial mortgage servicing rights portfolio valued at around $110 billion to a KeyCorp (KEY.N) unit for an undisclosed amount, the latest offloading of servicing assets which many big banks consider costly to collect on. Bank of America announced similar deals for more than $300 billion of servicing rights earlier this year. Terms of those deals showed comparatively small amounts of money changing hands. It sold servicing rights on $215 billion of mortgages for $1.3 billion to Nationstar Mortage Holdings (NSM.N) and rights to $93 billion of mortgages for $519 million to Walter Investments. In the wake of the housing crisis, many borrowers have gone into foreclosure and collecting mortgage payments has become expensive. The level of capital needed to back the loans is also higher for banks while smaller companies that specialize in servicing these loans do not have to follow bank capital rules.
